intro: Neuromanes abruptum, commonly known as the sudden abrupt plant, is a rare flowering species native to the temperate regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, branched stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its root system is fibrous and shallow. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
